com.dotcms.publisher.environment.business

Interface EnvironmentAPI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EnvironmentAPIImpl

    public interface EnvironmentAPI

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteEnvironment(java.lang.String id)
      deletes the Environment object with the given id and its permissions from the underlying data layer
      java.util.List<Environment> findAllEnvironments()
      Returns a List of all Environment objects, empty list if not environments are found
      Environment findEnvironmentById(java.lang.String id)
      Returns an Environment object whose id matches the given id, null if no match is found
      Environment findEnvironmentByName(java.lang.String name)
      Returns an Environment object whose name matches the given name, null if no match is found
      java.util.List<Environment> findEnvironmentsByBundleId(java.lang.String bundleId)
      Returns a List of Environment objects to whom the bundle with the given bundleId was sent to, empty list if not match is found
      java.util.Set<Environment> findEnvironmentsByRole(java.lang.String roleId)
      Returns a List of Environment objects that can be used by the Role with the given roleId, empty List if no match is found
      java.util.List<Environment> findEnvironmentsWithServers()
      Returns a List of all Environment objects which have Servers (or Endpoints) in it, empty list if not environments are found
      void saveEnvironment(Environment environment, java.util.List<Permission> perms)
      persists the given Environment object, and its permissions, to the underlying data layer
      void updateEnvironment(Environment environment, java.util.List<Permission> perms)
      updates the given Environment object in the underlying data layer

    • Method Detail

      • findEnvironmentById

        Environment findEnvironmentById(java.lang.String id)
                                throws DotDataException
        Returns an Environment object whose id matches the given id, null if no match is found
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the environment object to get
        Returns:
        the environment with the specified id
        Throws:
        DotDataException - thrown when an error in the underlying data layer occurs

      • findEnvironmentsByRole

        java.util.Set<Environment> findEnvironmentsByRole(java.lang.String roleId)
                                                  throws DotDataException,
                                                         NoSuchUserException,
                                                         DotSecurityException
        Returns a List of Environment objects that can be used by the Role with the given roleId, empty List if no match is found
        Parameters:
        roleId - the id of the role whose environments are requested
        Returns:
        the list of environments related to the given roleId
        Throws:
        DotDataException - thrown when an error in the underlying data layer occurs
        NoSuchUserException
        DotSecurityException

                     throws DotDataException,

        Parameters:
        environment - the environment to be persisted
        perms - a list of the environment's permissions to be persisted
        Throws:
        DotDataException - thrown when an error in the underlying data layer occurs
        DotSecurityException

      • findEnvironmentsByBundleId

        java.util.List<Environment> findEnvironmentsByBundleId(java.lang.String bundleId)
                                                       throws DotDataException
        Returns a List of Environment objects to whom the bundle with the given bundleId was sent to, empty list if not match is found
        Parameters:
        bundleId - the id of the bundle whose destination environments wants to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a list of environments
        Throws:
        DotDataException - thrown when an error in the underlying data layer occurs
